intro: Ouratea leblondii, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and white, often clustered in cymes. The fruit is an important food source for various bird species in its native habitat.
